item.title: Report E-2024110357
item.description:
Report E-2024110357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 12, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1292 was punctured and released approximately 40-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Tetraethyl Silicate-impacted trailer and dock and worked them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the 55-gallon drum of Tetraethyl Silicate was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon over-pack.

item.title: Report I-2024110042
item.description:
Report I-2024110042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-03
  • City: San Francisco
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: . Passenger Katrina Fineman in 8Ls iPad fell between her seat and she tried to get it herself before notifying flight attendants . 8L moved the seat multiple times which cracked and bent the iPad . FAs were able to retrieve the iPad . The iPad was not smoking at all . Captain directed to place the iPad in the TCB out of precaution . TCB was stored in Iav for remainder of flight C

item.title: Report E-2024110342
item.description:
Report E-2024110342

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 02:53 EST XPO-USA contacted ERTS to report a spill of 1 gallon of "PITTHANE ULTRA GLOSS" from a 1gal metal pail impacting the trailer floor. The pail was punctured by a forklift at USA. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who cleaned the spill with terminal-issued PPE.

item.title: Report I-2024110054
item.description:
Report I-2024110054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-13
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified on 10/22/2024 of a battery pack overheat event on 10/13/2024 during during the boarding phase of flight(DL960). A passengefs battery pack located inside a backpack began to spark and glow. No flames were observed. The flight attendant brought the back pack to the jet bridge and extinguished the battery pack with water. No injuries or evacuations were reported. The flight subsequently continued the boarding process. The NRC and FAA were notified.

item.title: Report X-2024110550
item.description:
Report X-2024110550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the OAKH location a fiberboard box was found damaged from rainwater. While getting the contents ready for rewrap a fiberboard box inside was observed to have DG markings and UN spec packaging but there were no DG marks on the outer fiberboard box. The fiberboard box with the DG markings contained a glass vile of mercury UN2809. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.description:
Report E-2024110262

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

item.title: Report E-2024110234
item.description:
Report E-2024110234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:21 AM ET, ULA contacted the call center to report a spill that was found on the dock in Santa Fe Springs, CA. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces of Potassium Chlorate, which released from 2–50-pound paper bags due to the pallet containing a total of 40-to-50-pound paper bags of the same property found tipped over. The terminal stated they will have to restack the pallet and there could potentially be other bags that are leaking. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces from 3-damaged bags of product released to trailer floor and adjacent product due to improper loading. The contractors overpacked bags of product, plastic shrink-wrap, PPE, and floor debris submerged in water to (2) 15-gallon metal drums and (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
